channel.title: Tips on making a powerful drop?
channel.description: Hey guys üëã. I have really been struggling making my drops powerful. I‚Äôve done some research and discovered that you normally introduce more bass in the drop. When I try that it does improve but then the track sounds like a block of noise. I‚Äôm trying to make a clean and satisfying drop for my tracks but I just can‚Äôt seem to achieve it. Is there anything that you guys can recommend for me to do? üòÅ

item.title: Tips on making a powerful drop?
item.dc:creator: AnirudhKhanna
item.description:
If you‚Äôre drop is a melodic drop with a hard hitting chord, I‚Äôd recommend using basses like Slope or Gravel. If It is a bass drop however, it can be whatever. A trap drop- boom basses.

item.title: Tips on making a powerful drop?
item.dc:creator: Cornea
item.description:
DUCKER

Highpass leads/dubstep basses

Add a sub

Mess with the key and tempo

delete and try again

Rinse repeat

item.title: Tips on making a powerful drop?
item.dc:creator: El1011
item.description:
i dont think that has as much to do with mixing as it does editing the instruments/sounds. There‚Äôs tutorials for getting more punchy or crispy sounding drums and instruments. Some eq is involved, but usually for individual instruments, not the whole mix.

Another good artist for this kind of sound (i guess) would be KSHMR. Tho he doesn‚Äôt really do house type stuff, the way his drums hit are pretty similar
